meanings.definition: To cry or whine with sniffling
meanings.sent1: The child was sniveling after falling off the swing.
meanings.sent2: She always starts sniveling when she doesn't get her way.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's sniveling over a dropped treat was both pitiful and adorable.
meanings.sent4: The sniveling wind outside matched the protagonist's sorrow in the story.
meanings.sent5: The sound of sniveling echoed through the empty hallway, haunting and melancholic.

meanings.definition: A person who snivels, especially in a whining or self-pitying way.
meanings.sent1: Don't be a sniveling child; stand up and face your fears.
meanings.sent2: The sniveling student always sought attention with their constant complaints.
meanings.sent3: The sniveling of the spoiled prince was met with eye rolls from the courtiers.
meanings.sent4: She saw herself as a sniveling mouse in a world of roaring lions.
meanings.sent5: The sniveling beggar touched the hearts of passersby with his genuine tears.
